verses.text: The song of songs, which \add is\add* Solomon's.
Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love \add is\add* better than wine.
Because of the savor of thy good ointments thy name \add is as\add* ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.
Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers; we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.
I \add am\add* black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

Look not upon me, because I \add am\add* black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; \add but\add* my own vineyard have I not kept.
Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest \add thy flock\add* to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?
If thou knowest not, O thou fairest among women, go forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds tents.
I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh's chariots.
Thy cheeks are comely with rows \add of jewels\add* , thy neck with chains \add of gold\add* .
We will make for thee borders of gold with studs of silver.
While the king \add sitteth\add* at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth its smell.
A bundle of myrrh \add is\add* my well beloved to me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
My beloved \add is\add* to me \add as\add* a cluster of camphor in the vineyards of En-gedi.
Behold, thou \add art\add* fair, my love; behold, thou \add art\add* fair; thou \add hast\add* doves' eyes.
Behold, thou \add art\add* fair, my beloved, yes, pleasant: also our bed \add is\add* green.
The beams of our house \add are\add* cedar, \add and\add* our rafters of fir.
